Mission.Author: KingRaptor
Mission.Description: An introduction to unit classes in Zero-K.
Mission.Name: Unit Classes Tutorial

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: Learn about the different unit classes in Zero-K. Practice with the provided units.
TriggerLogic.Title: Complete Tutorial

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action (Alternate)
TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
if WG.EconomyPanel then WG.EconomyPanel.SetEconomyPanelVisibility(false) end
local camState = Spring.GetCameraState() camState.height = 1200 camState.py = 1400 camState.rx = -60 Spring.SetCameraState(camState, 0)

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Now let's learn about the different \255\255\255\0\unit classes\008 in Zero-K.
Note that while the following descriptions will be broadly true of most or all unit types within a class, each unit has its own distinct traits that affect the way it is best used. Try them out in a skirmish or multiplayer game to learn their ins and outs.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
\255\255\255\0\Raiders\008 are fast and and do a lot of damage quickly, but have very low health. They are good against units with inaccurate weapons, such as skirmishers.
Kill the enemy units to continue.
TIP: Use attack move to have your raiders automatically attempt to evade enemy fire. Default hotkey is \255\0\255\0\A\008, in case you've forgotten.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action (Alternate)
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: local merlID = GG.mission.FindUnitInGroup("Merl") Spring.GiveOrderToUnit(merlID, 36214, {0}, 0) -- unit AI

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Riot\008 units excel at wiping out large numbers of small enemy units, such as raiders. They generally do a lot of damage quickly, but are slow, short-ranged and have modest health.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
\255\255\255\0\Skirmishers\008 have good range and are effective against slow, short-ranged units such as riots. They have relatively low health and damage output. Most have trouble with fast-moving targets. Don't let them get into close combat.
TIP: Use attack move to have your skirms try to keep their distance ("kite" the enemy).

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Some skirmishers can also destroy shorter-ranged enemy static defences from outside their range. Try it now.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Assault\008 units are tough and can brute-force enemy defences. Their speed is generally middling. Some have difficulty hitting fast-moving units.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Artillery\008 units use their long range to destroy defence structures from afar. Typical artillery units are not able to hit moving targets.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: \255\255\255\0\Anti\008-\255\255\255\0\aircraft\008 (AA) units can only hit planes and gunships but are the most cost-effective way of dealing with them. They have long range compared to most anti-ground weapons.

That concludes the unit classes demonstration. Feel free to continue practicing with the different units.
Click Next to end.
